Articles.Content: With KSP being one of the most popular games on steam, I think it would make sense to be able to upload crafts, flags and mods to steams workshop system. For steam KSP users, it is a long process to implement mods into the game. You have to sift through stacks of folders and files just to get to the KSP directory. If we had Workshop support, it would make the process quicker and easier and would supply greater support for the craft-sharing and modding community.

I invite you to read this.

Also, a lot of people playing KSP do not use Steam, but rather bought it from the KSP website itself.

I see no downside in having both solutions. It's not like we'd be losing the current method if they added Steam Workshop.

A quick title search tells me this gets suggested at least once every other month. Last time before this was .... YESTERDAY! And it was locked within 20 minutes.

Adding mods to the store bought version is EXACTLY the same amount of work as adding mods to the Steam version as both versions are IDENTICAL. You just drop the mod into your gamedata folder and you're done. You don't need workshop, you don't need CKAN. All you need is some basic common knowledge and the ability to click a mouse.
